Beginner.title: Basic Arithmetic
Beginner.content: Covers addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.
steps: Step 1: Practice with single-digit operations.
Step 2: Move to multi-digit problems.

Beginner.title: Order of Operations (PEMDAS)
Beginner.content: Evaluate expressions using Parentheses, Exponents, Multiplication/Division, Addition/Subtraction.
steps: Step 1: Resolve parentheses and exponents.
Step 2: Apply multiplication/division left-to-right, then addition/subtraction.

Beginner.title: Factors, Multiples, and Primes
Beginner.content: Prime factorization and divisibility are foundations for fractions and number theory.
steps: Step 1: Learn divisibility rules.
Step 2: Compute GCD and LCM using prime factors or Euclid's algorithm.

Beginner.title: Fractions and Mixed Numbers
Beginner.content: Work with equivalent fractions, simplification, and operations.
steps: Step 1: Reduce fractions to simplest form.
Step 2: Add/subtract with common denominators; multiply/divide directly.

Beginner.title: Decimals and Place Value
Beginner.content: Relate decimals to fractions; rounding and comparison.
steps: Step 1: Convert between decimals and fractions.
Step 2: Practice rounding and comparing decimals.

Beginner.title: Ratios and Proportions
steps: Step 1: Write ratios as fractions.
Step 2: Solve proportions by cross-multiplication.

Beginner.title: Percentages
Beginner.content: Convert between fractions, decimals, and percents; compute increases/decreases.
steps: Step 1: Convert percent to decimal (p% -> p/100).
Step 2: Apply base × rate to find part.

Beginner.title: Exponents and Roots (Intro)
Beginner.content: Powers, square roots, and basic laws.
steps: Step 1: Learn exponent rules (product, quotient, power).
Step 2: Practice roots and fractional exponents.

Beginner.title: Scientific Notation
steps: Step 1: Normalize mantissa to [1, 10).
Step 2: Adjust exponent to shift decimal.

Beginner.title: Basic Equations
Beginner.content: Solve one- and two-step linear equations.
steps: Step 1: Inverse operations to isolate variable.
Step 2: Check solutions by substitution.

Beginner.title: Coordinate Plane and Graphing
Beginner.content: Plot points and simple lines on the Cartesian plane.
steps: Step 1: Understand (x, y) pairs.
Step 2: Use slope-intercept form to graph lines.

Beginner.title: Basic Geometry
Beginner.content: Perimeter, area, and volume of common shapes.
steps: Step 1: Memorize key formulas.
Step 2: Apply with correct units.

Beginner.title: Units, Conversions, and Significant Figures
Beginner.content: Convert between units and record measurements with proper precision.
steps: Step 1: Use conversion factors.
Step 2: Round results to correct sig figs.

Beginner.title: Introductory Probability
Beginner.content: Basic outcomes, events, and simple probabilities.
steps: Step 1: Count total outcomes.
Step 2: Compute favorable/total.

Beginner.title: Descriptive Statistics (Basics)
Beginner.content: Mean, median, mode, range, and basic plots.
steps: Step 1: Summarize data with central tendency.
Step 2: Visualize with histograms/boxplots.

Intermediate.title: Algebra Basics
Intermediate.content: Algebra uses symbols and letters to represent numbers and quantities.
steps: Step 1: Learn to isolate variables.
Step 2: Solve simple linear equations.

Intermediate.title: Linear Equations and Inequalities
Intermediate.content: Solve and graph linear equations/inequalities; slope, intercepts.
steps: Step 1: Convert to slope-intercept or standard form.
Step 2: Graph and test points for inequalities.

Intermediate.title: Systems of Linear Equations
Intermediate.content: Solve 2x2 and 3x3 systems by substitution, elimination, or matrices.
steps: Step 1: Use elimination/substitution for small systems.
Step 2: Express as matrices and apply row-reduction.

Intermediate.title: Functions and Transformations
steps: Step 1: Determine domain/range.
Step 2: Apply transformation rules to graphs.

Intermediate.title: Polynomials and Factoring
steps: Step 1: Expand and simplify polynomials.
Step 2: Factor by common terms, grouping, or formulas.

Intermediate.title: Quadratic Functions
Intermediate.content: Vertex form, roots, completing the square, quadratic formula.
steps: Step 1: Identify a, b, c and compute discriminant.
Step 2: Solve via factoring, completing the square, or formula.

Intermediate.title: Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
Intermediate.content: Laws of exponents/logs; growth/decay; change of base.
steps: Step 1: Apply exponent/log rules.
Step 2: Solve equations by taking logs/exponentiating.

Intermediate.title: Rational Expressions and Equations
Intermediate.content: Simplify and solve with factoring and common denominators.
steps: Step 1: Factor and cancel common factors.
Step 2: Multiply both sides by LCD to clear denominators.

Intermediate.title: Sequences and Series
Intermediate.content: Arithmetic and geometric sequences; partial sums.
steps: Step 1: Identify type (arithmetic vs geometric).
Step 2: Use appropriate nth term and sum formulas.

Intermediate.title: Trigonometry Basics
Intermediate.content: Angles, right-triangle trig, unit circle, sine/cosine graphs.
steps: Step 1: Use SOH-CAH-TOA for right triangles.
Step 2: Learn key angles on the unit circle.

Intermediate.title: Matrices and Vectors (Intro)
Intermediate.content: Vector addition/scalar multiplication; matrix addition and multiplication.
steps: Step 1: Practice dot products and matrix multiplication.
Step 2: Interpret vectors as points and directions.

Intermediate.title: Complex Numbers
Intermediate.content: Arithmetic with i = sqrt(-1); polar form and Euler's formula.
examples: e^{iθ} = cos θ + i sin θ
steps: Step 1: Add/multiply using i^2 = -1.
Step 2: Convert between rectangular and polar forms.

Intermediate.title: Coordinate Geometry (Conics)
steps: Step 1: Identify standard forms.
Step 2: Complete the square to rewrite and analyze.

Intermediate.title: Combinatorics (Basics)
steps: Step 1: Decide if order matters.
Step 2: Apply permutations or combinations accordingly.

Intermediate.title: Discrete Probability Distributions (Intro)
steps: Step 1: Identify trial structure and parameters.
Step 2: Compute pmf, expectation, and variance.

Intermediate.title: Descriptive Statistics and z-scores
steps: Step 1: Compute mean and variance.
Step 2: Standardize values to compare across scales.

Intermediate.title: Limits and Continuity (Intro)
steps: Step 1: Apply algebraic simplification.
Step 2: Use one-sided limits to check continuity.

Intermediate.title: Introduction to Derivatives
Intermediate.content: Instantaneous rate of change and basic differentiation rules.
steps: Step 1: Apply power/product/quotient rules.
Step 2: Chain rule for compositions.

Intermediate.title: Introduction to Integrals
Intermediate.content: Antiderivatives and area under curves; Riemann sums.
steps: Step 1: Learn basic antiderivative formulas.
Step 2: Use FTC to connect derivatives and integrals.

Advanced.title: Calculus - Derivatives
Advanced.content: Derivatives represent the rate of change of a function.
steps: Step 1: Learn derivative rules (power, product, quotient, chain).
Step 2: Apply to real-world problems like velocity and acceleration.

Advanced.title: Calculus - Integrals
Advanced.content: Definite/indefinite integrals, substitution, parts, improper integrals.
steps: Step 1: Choose techniques (substitution, parts, partial fractions).
Step 2: Evaluate definite integrals numerically if needed.

Advanced.title: Multivariable Calculus
Advanced.content: Partial derivatives, gradients, Hessians, Taylor expansion.
steps: Step 1: Compute partials and gradient.
Step 2: Use Hessian for curvature and optimization.

Advanced.title: Vector Calculus
Advanced.content: Divergence, curl, line/surface integrals; Green, Gauss, Stokes theorems.
steps: Step 1: Parameterize curves/surfaces.
Step 2: Apply fundamental theorems to simplify integrals.

Advanced.title: Differential Equations (ODE)
Advanced.content: First/second-order ODEs, linear systems, stability.
steps: Step 1: Classify ODE and select method (separable, linear, exact).
Step 2: Analyze equilibrium and stability.

Advanced.title: Linear Algebra: Vector Spaces and Bases
Advanced.content: Span, linear independence, basis, dimension, rank-nullity.
steps: Step 1: Row-reduce to analyze independence and rank.
Step 2: Construct bases and compute coordinates.

Advanced.title: Linear Algebra: Orthogonality and Projections
Advanced.content: Inner products, orthonormal bases, least squares.
steps: Step 1: Orthonormalize (Gram-Schmidt).
Step 2: Solve least squares via normal equations or QR.

Advanced.title: Matrix Decompositions (LU, QR, SVD, Eig)
Advanced.content: Core tools for solving systems, regression, and dimensionality reduction.
steps: Step 1: Choose decomposition based on task (solve, orthonormal basis, low-rank).
Step 2: Use SVD for PCA and conditioning analysis.

Advanced.title: Matrix Calculus
Advanced.content: Derivatives of scalars/vectors/matrices; trace tricks.
steps: Step 1: Convert expressions to traces.
Step 2: Apply derivative identities systematically.

Advanced.title: Convex Analysis and Duality
Advanced.content: Convex sets/functions, subgradients, Fenchel and Lagrange duality.
examples: Dual of Lasso and SVM derivations
steps: Step 1: Verify convexity via epigraph or Hessian.
Step 2: Formulate Lagrangian and derive KKT conditions.

Advanced.title: Optimization Algorithms
Advanced.content: Gradient descent, SGD, momentum, Adam, Newton, LBFGS, line search.
steps: Step 1: Analyze smoothness/convexity to pick method.
Step 2: Tune stepsizes and stopping criteria.

Advanced.title: Probability Theory
Advanced.content: Random variables, expectation, variance, conditional probability, LLN, CLT.
examples: E[g(X)] = ∑ g(x) p(x) or ∫ g(x) f(x) dx
steps: Step 1: Identify distribution and its parameters.
Step 2: Compute moments and conditionals.

Advanced.title: Bayesian Inference
Advanced.content: Priors, likelihoods, posteriors, conjugacy, credible intervals.
steps: Step 1: Choose prior compatible with likelihood.
Step 2: Derive posterior and summarize with moments/intervals.

Advanced.title: Statistical Inference (MLE, MAP, Testing)
Advanced.content: Point estimation, bias-variance, CIs, hypothesis tests.
steps: Step 1: Formulate likelihood and estimator.
Step 2: Assess uncertainty and test hypotheses.

Advanced.title: Information Theory
Advanced.content: Entropy, cross-entropy, KL divergence, mutual information; relevant to ML losses.
steps: Step 1: Compute entropies from distributions.
Step 2: Use KL/CE as optimization objectives.

Advanced.title: Sampling Methods
Advanced.content: Monte Carlo, importance sampling, MCMC (Metropolis-Hastings, Gibbs).
steps: Step 1: Choose proposal/sampler.
Step 2: Diagnose convergence and effective sample size.

Advanced.title: Graphs and Networks
Advanced.content: Graph theory basics, Laplacian, spectral properties.
steps: Step 1: Construct adjacency/degree matrices.
Step 2: Use eigenvectors of L for clustering/embedding.

Advanced.title: Kernel Methods and RKHS
Advanced.content: Positive definite kernels, feature maps, representer theorem.
steps: Step 1: Verify kernel PSD.
Step 2: Solve in dual with kernel trick.

Advanced.title: Numerical Linear Algebra
Advanced.content: Conditioning, stability, iterative solvers (CG), preconditioning.
examples: CG for symmetric positive definite systems
steps: Step 1: Analyze conditioning and scaling.
Step 2: Choose stable algorithms and preconditioners.

Advanced.title: Fourier Analysis and Signal Processing
Advanced.content: Fourier series/transform, convolution, spectral methods.
steps: Step 1: Transform to frequency domain.
Step 2: Filter/denoise via spectral manipulation.

Advanced.title: Stochastic Processes
Advanced.content: Markov chains, Poisson processes, HMM basics.
steps: Step 1: Build transition models.
Step 2: Analyze stationarity and mixing.

Advanced.title: High-Dimensional Statistics
Advanced.content: Concentration inequalities, curse of dimensionality, sparsity.
steps: Step 1: Apply concentration to generalization bounds.
Step 2: Use sparsity/regularization to control complexity.

Advanced.title: Random Matrix Theory (Intro)
Advanced.content: Spectral distributions and implications for optimization/ML.
steps: Step 1: Study eigenvalue distributions.
Step 2: Relate spectra to generalization and conditioning.

Advanced.title: Measure-Theoretic Probability (Basics)
Advanced.content: Sigma-algebras, measures, Lebesgue integration; foundations for advanced ML theory.
steps: Step 1: Define probability space.
Step 2: Work with convergence notions (a.s., L2).

Advanced.title: Tensors and Tensor Decompositions
Advanced.content: Order-k arrays, CP/Tucker decompositions, tensor rank.
examples: CP: X ≈ ∑ r a_r ⊗ b_r ⊗ c_r
steps: Step 1: Choose decomposition model.
Step 2: Fit with ALS or gradient-based methods.

Advanced.title: Automatic Differentiation and Computational Graphs
Advanced.content: Forward/reverse mode AD, graph-based derivatives.
steps: Step 1: Build computational graph.
Step 2: Accumulate derivatives efficiently.

Advanced.title: PDEs and Variational Methods
Advanced.content: Euler–Lagrange equations, energy minimization, diffusion.
steps: Step 1: Formulate functional to minimize.
Step 2: Derive EL equations and solve/approximate.

Advanced.title: Regularization and Norms
Advanced.content: L1/L2 norms, elastic net, constraints and penalties; bias-variance trade-off.
steps: Step 1: Choose norm/penalty fitting problem structure.
Step 2: Analyze effects on sparsity and stability.
